content: The "Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance Enhancement Act of 2005" repeals a section of a previous Act and increases the maximum coverage under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance and Veterans' Group Life Insurance from $250,000 to $400,000. The "Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance Enhancement Act of 2005" raises the maximum coverage under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance and Veterans' Group Life Insurance from $250,000 to $400,000. Amendments are made to sections 1967 and 1977 of title 38, United States Code to reflect the new maximum coverage amounts. The amendments made by the "Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance Enhancement Act of 2005" raise the maximum coverage under Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance and Veterans' Group Life Insurance to $400,000. The amendments also update sections 1967 and 1977 of title 38, United States Code to reflect the new maximum coverage amounts. The effective date for these changes is September 1, 2005, and applies to deaths occurring on or after that date. SEC. 4. SPOUSAL NOTIFICATIONS RELATING TO SERVICEMEMBERS' GROUP LIFE INSURANCE PROGRAM. Effective September 1, 2005, section 1967 of title 38, United States Code, was amended to include provisions for notifying a member's spouse regarding insurance elections. If a married member elects not to be insured, the spouse must be notified. Additionally, if a member reduces their insurance coverage, the spouse must be informed in writing. The amendment to section 1967 of title 38, United States Code, requires notifying a member's spouse of any insurance elections that reduce coverage. If a member designates a beneficiary other than their spouse or child, the spouse must be notified in writing. The amendment to section 1967 of title 38, United States Code requires notifying a member's spouse of insurance elections that reduce coverage. A notification to the spouse is satisfied by a good faith effort to provide the required information at the spouse's last known address. Failure to provide timely notification does not affect the validity of any election or beneficiary designation. SEC. 5. INCREMENTS OF INSURANCE THAT MAY BE ELECTED. The increment amount for insurance elections under section 1967 of title 38, United States Code, must be evenly divisible by $50,000. This amendment is effective as of September 1, 2005.
